Earth & Space 2026

13 April 2026 – 16 April 2026

American Society of Civil Engineers College Station, TX, United States

The Earth & Space 2026 Conference, officially the 20th International Conference on Engineering, Science, Construction, and Operations in Challenging Environments, will hold from April 13 to 16, 2026, at Texas A&M University in College Station, Texas.

Earth & Space 2026 focuses on the engineering, scientific, and operational challenges associated with harsh environments such as the lunar and Martian surfaces, deep space, and extreme terrestrial locations. The conference provides a unique platform to share cutting-edge research, innovative technologies, and practical solutions for sustainable human and robotic presence beyond Earth’s atmosphere. It also addresses critical infrastructure and construction challenges that arise when designing and operating systems in these demanding conditions.

This conference is particularly timely as it coincides with the opening of the Texas A&M University Space Institute in fall 2026, a state-of-the-art research facility located near NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston. The Space Institute will feature the world’s largest indoor simulation environments replicating lunar and Martian surfaces, high-bay laboratories, and collaborative spaces designed to accelerate space exploration research and development. This proximity to NASA and the collaborative environment the institute fosters will enhance the conference’s impact by providing attendees with direct access to cutting-edge facilities and research initiatives.

Earth & Space Themes and Symposia

Earth & Space 2026 is structured around several specialized symposia that cover a broad range of topics critical to space and extreme environment engineering:

Granular Materials in Space Exploration: Exploring the behavior and utilization of lunar and Martian regolith, soil mechanics, and material handling in low-gravity environments

.Exploration and Utilization of Extra-Terrestrial Bodies: Discussing mission planning, surface operations, resource extraction, and habitat construction on the Moon, Mars, and other celestial bodies.

Advanced Materials and Designs for Aerospace and Terrestrial Structures: Innovations in materials science and structural engineering tailored for extreme temperature, radiation, and mechanical stress conditions.

Structures in Challenging Environments: Focusing on dynamics, controls, smart structures, health monitoring, and sensor technologies to ensure safety and reliability.

Space Engineering, Construction, and Architecture for Moon, Mars, and Beyond: Addressing architectural design, construction techniques, and infrastructure development for permanent human settlements in space.

These symposia encourage interdisciplinary collaboration, bringing together civil engineers, aerospace engineers, architects, scientists, and industry leaders to exchange knowledge and develop integrated solutions for future space missions and terrestrial applications.

Impact Orbit Creative Group

Impact Orbit Creative Group is a multi-disciplinary consultancy and innovation hub focused on driving sustainable growth, digital transformation, and impact-led strategies in the space and technology sectors. We partner with organisations and startups worldwide to deliver strategic guidance, communications expertise, and frameworks for responsible innovation.
